etymology.description: Pictogram of a nose; later borrowed as a phonetic loan (jiajie) to write “oneself; from,” while 鼻 took over the ‘nose’ meaning.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a nose. The graph was later repurposed for a similarly pronounced word meaning “self/from,” and a new character 鼻 came to represent ‘nose.’

examples.chinese: 他自北京来(他自北京來)。
自从去年起(自從去年起)，她自学法语(她自學法語)。
examples.pinyin: Zìcóng qùnián qǐ, tā zìxué Fǎyǔ.
examples.english: Since last year, she has self-studied French.
